DOC.brief_summary: Patients benefitting from a lung transplantation are subject to long-lasting and often severe post-operative pain. Self-hypnosis has been proven effective in the management of acute pain. The study hypothesis is that pre-operative training in self-hypnosis given to patients awaiting lung transplantation, will result in a reduction of post-operative pain one month after surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Interest of Learning Self-hypnosis for Patients Awaiting Lung Transplantation
DOC.criteria: patients over 15 years of age indication of lung transplantation patient unable to receive training in selfhypnosis (for cognitive, linguistic or cultural reasons)
